fields.description:
h3. Summary

Switching sprint dropdown is blocked by the status columns
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Agile - 7.2.5-D20160324T050506, 7.2.6-D20160330T044439
 * Confirmed in most recent versions of Chrome and Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Parrelle sprints
 # have 3 or more active sprints
 # Click on the Swith Sprint dropdown

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown is visible for all sprints
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown is placed in the background and cannot be fully viewed
h3. Workaround

Using Up & Down arrow button and Enter to select works to select the sprint
fields.summary: Quick filters auto complete are not working in Chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
in the jira sizing Guide:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html#JIRASizingGuide-experts

The Contact us link in the section *Sizing Recommendations* hits a 404 page not found:
{quote}
We recommend that you collaborate with one of our Experts to receive a specific recommendation. If you're interested for a referral for a partner/expert, please [contact us | https://www.atlassian.com/resources/experts/?tab=contact-the-experts-team&_ga=1.120208008.1491907991.1475592422]. 
{quote}

Link in notation is:
- {{https://www.atlassian.com/resources/experts/?tab=contact-the-experts-team&_ga=1.120208008.1491907991.1475592422}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Looks like it should be directing to:
- https://www.atlassian.com/experts/contact
fields.summary: JIRA Sizing Guide 404 redirect from link

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
In some scenario, Scrum master needs to include additional issues in the sprint which must only be worked on after the main issues have been completed. At the moment, if the additional issues are added to the sprint after the sprint has been started will be marked as scope changes. If these additional issues are added since the beginning of the sprint being planned (together with other main issues), this will lead to other user mistakenly work on it before other main issues get completed.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the capability to add issues at the start of the sprint and for them to be clearly identified during the sprint that these are additional issues which have to be worked on after main issues are completed. In other word, I don’t want anyone to start working on these additional issues by mistake. The additional issues could either be labeled or shown/listed in a different pool or swimlane, but still in that sprint.
fields.summary: Having marker for issues within the sprint to indicate order of issues to work on

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
In some scenario, Scrum master needs to include additional issues in the sprint which must only be worked on after the main issues have been completed. At the moment, if the additional issues are added to the sprint after the sprint has been started will be marked as scope changes. If these additional issues are added since the beginning of the sprint being planned (together with other main issues), this will lead to other user mistakenly work on it before other main issues get completed.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the capability to add issues at the start of the sprint and for them to be clearly identified during the sprint that these are additional issues which have to be worked on after main issues are completed. In other word, there should be a marker in the sprint to indicate the order of issues to work on, or set dependency in issues (additional issues must be worked on only after main issues are completed)
fields.summary: Having marker or depedency for issues within the sprint to indicate order of issues to work on

fields.description: As a JIRA admin, I want the ability to display issues from past sprints along with the current backlog issues and I'd like them organized in much the same way the active sprint issues are separated from the backlog issues
fields.summary: Display issues from past sprints along with the current backlog issues

fields.description:
Currently the same list of sprints is visible across all the projects.

I suggest a Project is associated to a Sprint Scheme and a Sprint Scheme has his own list of Sprints.

This approach is aligned with Jira's approach towards configurations and gives full flexibility of configuration.
fields.summary: Ability to map set of Sprints to Projects using Sprints and Sprints Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After you drag and drop something and you pick up another item to drag and drop, the window automatically scrolls down a bit, sometimes putting the 'drop' destination out of view.
 At the sample video attached, when user drag the third item, the auto scroll makes the destination go off the screen
h3. Suggested Solution

Reduce the speed of the scroll when you're dragging and dropping issues to other sprints or backlog
fields.summary: Dragging and drop an issue to sprint cause screen go out focus

fields.description:
Hi...I really need the physical calendar day to show in the Agile Sprint gadget...not just the days remaining.

This could be applicable to any or all of "Sprint Burndown Gadget", "Sprint Health Gadget", or "Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget".
fields.summary: Calendar date for Sprint End Date in Gadgets

fields.description:
Team ,

 

Could you pleas guide me details document to add JIRA from local authentication to AD auth .

 

 

TX,

Vivek
fields.summary: Need information to add Jira to Active directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the circumstance where a new issue type is introduced into JIRA, issues of that issue type may inadvertently be associated with existing Board filters which were not already configured to filter based on issue type.

In these circumstances, if the user does intend for that new issue type to enter the scope of these boards, they must manually modify each board filter to exclude these issue type(s), which can be a large effort depending on the number of boards which must be tweaked.


h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be beneficial in these situations to allow for a setting or configuration which globally blocks an issue type from appearing across all Boards.

Or, at the time of issue type creation, direct the user through a screen which either enables or disables that association with all of the boards in the instance that they have permissions to modify

h3. Workaround 

Retroactively modify all historical boards.
fields.summary: Allow for specific issue types to be globally excluded from all boards

fields.description:
Hello,

this is a feature request, as a spinoff of closed service desk issue:

[https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-227786]

We are integrating Github with JIRA cloud. As we follow the Git Flow development model, we find ourselves rebasing our feature branches on the `develop` branch daily. The obsolete (and unreachable) commits still show on the Git integration section on the issue. This is confusing, especially if the number of commits is large, and if the number of rebases is also large, as I end up seeing dozens and dozens of commits, instead of the real, "reachable" commits.

I have used JIRA (on-premise) integrated with on-premise Stash, and I am quite sure that we never had this issue.

The support engineer I spoke with in the linked service desk issue adviced me to overcome this by forcing a complete syncing. This works, but this is merely a workaround, as I have to do this all the time.

I would suggest enhancing your Github integration by implementing the same behaviour you are already providing when integrating with Stash (and presumably Bitbucket as well). I believe that it greatly degrades the integration you are providing.
fields.summary: Jira/Github integration - deleted commits still show

fields.description:
h4. Problem
It would be helpful to be able to analyze information about Sprints outside of JIRA.

h4. Solution
Currently this requires using a filter to find all open/closed/future sprints and export that. It would be  better if there was an export option in the Sprint Report screen.
fields.summary: Add ability to export all Sprint Reports for a Project to Excel

fields.description:
Sprint health gadget can only show one sprint in its view.

Would be useful if there's a way to see multiple sprints in the Sprint health gadget.
fields.summary: Show multiple sprint in Sprint health gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Documentation for JIRA in the following guide suggests there is an *Issue Status* section: [Viewing a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/viewing-a-project-802172399.html]

This may cause some confusion for administrators since the section appears to be missing. This section is not included natively in a vanilla installation of JIRA Core or JIRA Software and the documentation needs to be updated to reflect this (or clarify how the section is added).
h3. Suggested Solution

To have documentation from [Viewing a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/viewing-a-project-802172399.html] be updated to reflect a vanilla installation of JIRA Core or JIRA Software.
h3.
fields.summary: Request for documentation to be updated regarding Issue Status section in project summary page
Sprint custom field doesn't contain JSON in webhook bodies

fields.description:
h3. *Description*

Add the RANK system field to show in the card layout on SCRUM boards.

h3. *Example*

When configuring the card layout in the backlog of a JIRA software project, the ability to add to the list the *RANK [LOCKED]* field, although it is presented on the screen it does not show as an option to add in *Configure* screen of the backlog.

How to access that.

{panel:borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8} 

# Go to the Software Project > Backlog.
# On top right button 'Board' > select *Configure*
# Right-sided menu > *Card layout*.
# Under *Backlog* click on *Add*.
# RANK is a field in issues but does not appear for the picking.
{panel}

!board_rank.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggestion*

Add the RANK as possible field to show on the card layout of the backlog board.
fields.summary: Add the RANK field in card layout of SCRUM projects backlog
MVP development for VIBEAM

fields.description: Add the ability to hide the priority icon from the card layouts. Setting the field as hidden in the field configuration does not reflect on boards.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the priority icon from agile boards.

fields.description:
Hi,

[~klingsd1939976045] reported the following issue in our Ecosystem Developer ServiceDesk: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-69]

One of their add-ons has 2 workflow post functions, they show up normally when they try to use them in a JIRA Business or regular workflow. 

But if they use the Simplified Workflow from JIRA Software only one of them shows up. According to this documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/using-the-simplified-workflow-829056836.html] None of them should show up, as the Simplified Workflow doesn't support 3rd party add-ons.

Steven did some brute-force trail/error and found that the

<addable>ordinary,common</addable>

tag in the <workflow-function> clause in atlassian-plug.xml is the culprit.

Cheers,

Peter
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow shows some 3rd party post functions.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Links mentioned in [Managing epics with the Kanban backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/managing-epics-in-a-kanban-project-856846191.html#ManagingepicsinaKanbanproject-managingepicskanbanbacklogManagingepicswiththeKanbanbacklog] should be [Enabling the Kanban Backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-columns-764477997.html#Configuringcolumns-enablingkanbanbacklog]
fields.summary: Link in doc pointing different documentation

fields.description:
If you have the following:  
 * a scrum board that uses Story Points as the estimation statistic
 * you have Issues in a Sprint have Sub-Tasks with no Story Points estimate on them

JIRA will present a warning when you start the Sprint indicating your Sub Task issues have no esitmate on them.

This is a little strange since in Agile, backlog items are estimated at the Issue level, not the sub-task level.  Addtionally, JIRA Reports such as the Velocity Chart and Sprint Report don't seem to take into account the Story Points value on the Sub-Tasks.
fields.summary: Don't require Story Points value on Sub-Tasks when starting a Sprint

fields.description:
The point is to get some more information to the favicon, especialy, what kind of project/board is opened.

For example, we have 3 boards for one project: backlog, bugs and feedback. It will be great to be able to distinguish which browser tab is which  by favicon. 

Background: I work as PM in a small company, so I have multiple projects to manage, and even more boards to work in. I oftenly have multiple boards and projects open. It will be great to have some more information from the favicon on the pinned tab(my case), or if there is a lot of tabs open, that only favicons are visible (not my case).
fields.summary: Favicon for projects/boards
Project for feature releases in Momdeli

fields.description: Our kanban teams do not estimate work, but rely on making small pieces of work that flow with low variance. I would like to be able to see epic status based on issue state and not estimates, in the same way that I can see release status based on issue state.
fields.summary: As a Kanban team, I would like to see Epic progress based on issue status, not estimates

fields.description:
When configuring a board, I can choose to "Base Swimlanes" on either Stories or Queries. I'd like to have both types at once: one swimlane for each story (containing their subtasks) and another swimlane for bugs.

To me, the ideal Scrum board would be like this:
- Swimlane 1: Story 1 and its tasks
- Swimlane 2: Story 2 and its tasks
- Swimlane 3: Bugs
- Swimlane 4: Technical debt
fields.summary: Allow creation of separate swimlanes for stories (and their tasks) and bugs

fields.description:
+Issue Summary+

When a user focuses on an issue in the JIRA backlog, when the issue detail pops up, there are no options to allow the user to transition the issue.

+How to Replicate+

# Create a sample agile board with a few issues.
# Focus on an issue in the sprint to show the issue detail.
# Attempt to transition an issue or change the issue status.

+Expected Behavior+
There is a way to transition the issue.

+Actual Behavior+

It is impossible to modify most fields from this detail view and issues cannot be transitioned.

Users would either need to:
# Open the issue and transition it as usual of
# Go to the {{Active Sprints}} page and transition the issue by moving it along the column.
fields.summary: Ability to Transition Issues from the Backlog

fields.description:
When accessing the main page for a JIRA project, you have a sidebar where one of the options is to list all boards that have issues from the project. Today, only boards that have a filter which explicitly mention the project with a 'project' clause will appear in this list, leading to some confusion on which boards have issues from the project.

Would be better to have in this list all boards that have issue from the project, whenever the filter used by the board is.
fields.summary: From the project sidebar, show all boards that have issues from the project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Would like the ability to change the color/contrast of the Days in Column Indicator to be a more pronounced so that we can more easily identify issues that have been in a Column for a short period of time

Currently issues that are new or have been in a Column for a few days show a light grey indicator on a white card.  As the issue 'ages' the color changes gradients from light to a darker grey.  
!DaysInColumnExamples.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to have a solid color instead of a gradient or darken the initial color of the indicator
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Ability to Change Color of Days in Column Indicators for Higher Visibility

fields.description:
How long will it take to have streaming algorithms with data sets?
All current streaming algorithms are supporting RDDs.
fields.summary: Spark streaming algorithms for datasets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Seeing a sprint that a story does not belong to in an Epic Burndown can be confusing. This is currently the [expected behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Epic+Burndown] when a story is closed outside a sprint's start and end date. However, it is difficult to determine where a story will go to if there are multiple Active Sprints start/end at around the same time.

h3. Suggested Solution
On Epic Burndown calculation, consider Sprint value as part of the formula.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown to consider Sprint value of a Story
Extend The Expand/Collapse All Swimlanes Shortcut '-' To Collapse Backlog As Well

fields.description:
Be able to have notes/comments on an Agile Board.  I see this working like this:
MVP: 
Have a notepad icon on the Agile board next to the Reports button.
When the user clicks on it a dialog pops up with the one large edit box and the ability to view or edit the text.
MVP+1:
Have the OPTION to limit the edit ability to just the Board owner/project admins
MVP+2:
When you hover over the icon, the text for the note appears.
MVP+3:
Have text field indicating the last user who edited the text and date of the edit.
MVP+4:
Make it work like a message stream where people can enter text and there is a stream of conversations that the user can scroll back through.  But still have a static, un-editable text field in addition to this that is editable by ONLY the Board owner/project admin. And have the ability for the user can use @notation to mention another user who will get an email with the text that was entered.  


Benefit:
This allows Board admins/creators to provide explanations about the use of the board, what the user is seeing, what the filters are for, notes that can be carried from
fields.summary: Be able to have notes/comments on an Agile Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Workload by Assignee does not show the correct remaining time for subtasks. It sums up the Remaining Time estimate to the assignee of the parent task instead of to the actual assignees.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software Cloud (Agile version: {{1000.135.0}})

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue 1 (estimate it 1h) and issue 2 (estimate it 1h)
 # Create subtask of issue 1 (estimate it 30min)
 # Add the issues to a Sprint
 # Assign the issue 1 to user A and issue 2 to user B
 # Assign the subtask of issue 1 to assignee B

h3. Expected Results

The remaining time estimate should show 1h 30minutes for the assignee B
h3. Actual Results

The remaining time estimate shows 1h 30minutes for the assignee A
 * !Workload by assignee remaining time.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: The Workload by Assignee shows the remaining time for subtasks as a sum in the parent task instead of to the assignee

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some reports (Velocity Chart, Sprint / Burndown Report) will show completed issues as not done or completed outside the sprint if the workflow is changed, where by the DONE status is unmapped from the board and not mapped to the last (right most) column on the board.

Jira business logic defines issues that are in the last column as complete. Any issues that aren’t in the last column on the board will be considered incomplete, irrespective of the status category mapped to that column.

This impacts the data that’s pulled through to reports.
h3. Suggested Solution

Update Jira business / report logic where ‘Done’ is based on a status category or workflow and not column position.
h3. Why this is important

Users with workflows that do not have ‘Done’ or ‘Done’ mapped to the last column will not be able to use reports for insights.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 22nd March 2021}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your feedback on this problem. We appreciate the time that you took to help us be better.

Though not ideal in some cases, the behaviour in-product today is not a bug. Proposed improvements here are a feature request and have to be prioritized against other requests.

This is how reports and boards work in Jira:
 # *Reports and sprints are burning down issues based on the last column on the board.*
 # *Our current reports are not built to report issues being done based on an issue’s entire lifecycle (done-done), but based on when each board’s work is done (last column), and the reports belong only to one board.*

*Expected Result*
 As a user, I update my board’s workflow. I don’t map the Done status to the last column on the board. What this means is:
 * The Done status category is no longer associated with the last column on the board.
 * The column with the Done status category is now in another position on the board (that’s not the last column).
 * When using multiple boards, some boards intentionally don’t have Done in the last column. One board could be a QA board and the issue is only considered complete when it reaches the Releases board.

I expect the story points completed in the sprint will show as completed in reports.

*Actual Result*
 The business logic in Jira defines issues that are in the last column as complete. Any issues that aren’t in the last column on the board will be considered incomplete, irrespective of the status category mapped to that column.

This impacts the data that’s pulled through to your reports.
 * The velocity report will show 0 completed story points.
 * The sprint report will convert previously completed issues with a Done status to their previous state such as To do or In progress.

To mitigate any problems, try this workaround:
 # Go to *Board* > *Manage workflow*.
 # Add the removed Done status to your workflow. Give the status the same name as previously used in your workflow and reports.
 # At this stage, avoid adding any incoming transitions.
 # Save and publish the workflow.
 # From your board, navigate to the More actions (*•••*) > *Board settings*.
 # In *Columns and statuses*, move the Done status to the rightmost column.
 # Hit save.
 # Your reports should behave as before. Add any incoming transitions to the status.

We’re using bugs to track any issues that prevent our features from being used as intended.

But we also understand and appreciate this escalation, and have *converted this to a feature suggestion* instead. This feature request will *allow you to specify which status category is considered done on a board and in existing reports.*

Please watch this Jira issue for future updates as we continue to work on improving reports.

This feature request requires a large investment and will be prioritized against other high-priority feature requests. On behalf of the Atlassian team, we take your feedback seriously and understand both the frustration and the urgency.

Please let me know if you have any further questions about this ticket.

Regards,
 Ivan Teong
 Product Manager, Jira Software Cloud
{panel}
fields.summary: Update Report Logic where 'Done' is based on a status category or workflow

fields.description:
I couldn't make a bug so I am putting this here.

I found a ticket in your system (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14863) that mimics what we're experiencing, but on Kanban boards. We are having this issue on a *Scrum *Board.

1) Navigate to specific board
2) Notice lack of backlog navigation icons on left pane Board.
     a) navigation icons on left pane are appearing to be "Project" associated icons, not Board icons.
fields.summary: Backlog icon/link isn't showing on Scrum Board for some users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 26 October 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hello everyone,

We just finished the roll out to address the root cause for the board and sprint issue. 

* [Boards are disconnected from the projects|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15070]

The current status is that the root issue has been addressed and functionality for your boards and sprints has been restored. 

If you have any additional concerns or questions, please do not hesitate to let us know. [statuspage|http://atlassian.statuspage.io/incidents/ttls1490n468]
{panel}

Also, in the future, major issues/outages are communicated in our Status page, status.atlassian.com
fields.summary: JSW-11878 has re-emerged

fields.description:
Schedule and Edit permissions are required to add an issue to a Sprint.

When creating an issue on the Active Sprints board without these permissions the option to add to sprint is offered, but clicking it will lead to an error.

Suggest not offering the option when not possible to succeed.

!add-to-option.png|thumbnail!

!add-to-fail.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When creating an issue without ability to add to a sprint do not offer to add to sprint

fields.description: As a JIRA Admin, I should be given default admin access to all boards and projects created in JIRA, so that, when a user leaves the company, I can fix and/or update the items created by that user so I'm not stuck with a corrupt board which impacts the integrity of my data.
fields.summary: JIRA Admin access to all boards by default

fields.description:
Can we customize the panel to show based upon different attribute in Backlog of a Board ?

Like in the attached screen shot if u see i have EPIC & VERSONS where can i change it to show & categorise on say some other parameter like "Fixed Version"
fields.summary: Can we customize the panel to show based upon different attribute in Backlog of a Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking on the "Contact an administrator to perform this action." results in XSRF Security Token Missing. 

Tested with :
 # Chrome Version 54.0.2840.59 (64-bit)
 # Firefox 49.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Outgoing Mail
 # Enable Contact Administrators Form from General Configurations 
 # Create a Scrum Project with a board
 # Change the workflow of the project so that the Simplified Workflow option will be enabled on the Columns page
 !image-2016-10-25-16-04-57-091.png!
 # Create a new user without any admin privileges. 
 # Assign this user as a Board Administrators from configure Board > General
 # Login as the new user 
 # Go to configure Board > Column
 # Click on "Contact an administrator to perform this action."  !image-2016-10-25-16-09-53-391.png!

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to see the "Contact an administrator" form. 
h3. Actual Results

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
{quote}
Your browser has not provided any parameters at all and your input has been lost. Press back now to try and resend the data. This is most likely caused by a bug in the browser. FireFox 3.6.0 have been known to exhibit this behavior.
 For more information see this bug report [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20696]
 JIRA could not complete this action due to a missing form token.
 You may have cleared your browser cookies, which could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.
 Request URL: /jira6413/secure/ContactAdministrators.jspa
{quote}
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing when clicking on Contact an administrator
Should be able to delete own suggestions and issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no possibility to restrict users from adding issues to Active Sprints. A user has permission to add issues to Sprint if they have:
* Schedule Issues permission and
* Edit Issues permission

This means they can rank issues in the Backlog and Add issues to Sprints (Future and Active). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add restriction so only some users can Add issues to a Sprint that is Active

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Only some users should be allowed to add issues to Active Sprints (Scope Change)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the latest release, JIRA v1000.456.2, the Kanban Backlog is showing the subtasks in Backlog. 
Customers that were previously using Backlog on Scrum Board, expect that subtasks should not be shown. 
Customer says that having subtasks in Backlog makes planing difficult. 

*  !Subtasks in Backlog.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the subtasks form Kanban Backlog

h3. Workaround
Use a filter for the board that doesn't show sub-tasks
{code}
project = "Project Name" and issuetype != Sub-task ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Note: Because of the filter used, the subtasks are not shown in the Kanban Board neither but there is a note in the Issue Detail View. 
* !Subtask in Issue Detail View.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Kanban Board should not show sub-tasks in Backlog

fields.description: The hash ID that is reported on the error page is: f09b7f9f03664e75a8ea8499a5fd8bbb
fields.summary: Cannot login with my account.
E-book audits and catch-up loads

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the user goes to  {{Agile Board Backlog>Select any Issue>Issue Detail View>More Actions>Click Dropdown}}, then you see the workflow transitions. However, it is not possible to set the sequence order for these.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable admins to set sequence order for this, possible getting these values from JIRA {{opsbar-sequence}} transition property.
fields.summary: Workflow operations should have the same sequence order in View Issue and the Agile Issue Detail View

fields.description:
*UPDATE:*

We have developed a fix for this incident, and we are working on rolling it out to all affected customers right now. The fix will be available within 24 hours, but in most situations much sooner.

h2. Summary

There are several symptoms at play:

# Boards are not connected to projects, leading to a missing 'backlog' button and making the board very difficult or sometimes impossible to find.
# Start/Stop sprint functionality is not available.
# Agile Reports are not available

h2. Steps to replicate
# Click on *Project* from the top navigation bar
# Click on any project
# *Backlog* and *Active Sprint* buttons are missing from the project sidebar

h2. Expected behavior
The Backlog and Active Sprint buttons should display on the project sidebar
 !1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Current behavior
The Backlog and Active Sprint buttons are not showing on the project sidebar
 !2.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Workarounds
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Boards are disconnected from the projects

fields.description: There are other tickets asking for a favorites feature for boards, but this will not solve our problem.  Our instance is 2000 users and 300 projects and boards a VERY popular for good reason.  However this success has cone with a downside.  We have so many boards created over time that the list takes a very long time to load.  Users forget to deleted boards they no longer use and being able to manage this by reporting on boards that have not been used in  6-12 months is a basic management need for this.  Viewing if a project has has activity is NOT sufficient for this need as a particular board may no longer be used even if the project is still active.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I need to see the date an Agile board was last accessed to notify users to delete unused boards

fields.description: Right now I have to edit the issue, I can't do it quickly in the right panel.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to edit the duedate field in the issue detail view

fields.description:
As it is now, when you click on a link to an issue in the "Agile Board" view, where it is one of a list of issues, it behaves the same as clicking anywhere else on that element by opening a small UI element on the right side of the page with the issue information. 

In my experience, it is very counterintuitive that you cannot open a dedicated issue view by clicking this link, and instead have to click the identical looking link in the sidebar issue view to actually open up a new tab with the dedicated issue view.

I've attached a photo with an example. This isn't the view I use, but has the same issue. In this photo, I think clicking the BSERV-8147 link in either place should have the same behavior.
fields.summary: Links to issues inside movable elements should open issue in a new window

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Where's my field" is only populated under the admin dropdown on issue view screen if navigating through a linked issue.

h3. Environment
* Started in Server 7.2.1 (Previous versions not reproducible)
* Cloud v1000.383.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue
# Select Admin Dropdown

h3. Expected Results
"Where's my field" is present under the admin dropdown.

h3. Actual Results
"Where's my field" is missing
 
h3. Notes
The "Where's my field" is present if you navigate to an issue through a linked issue:
!Screen Shot 2016-10-17 at 9.53.28 AM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2016-10-17 at 9.59.18 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
# Navigate to the same issue via another issue that is linked to it
# Select Admin Dropdown and "Where's my field" will be present Present
fields.summary: Where's my field missing from admin drop down

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

Navigate to the report tab

Select version report

Select the version that has not yet started (it's start date is in the future).

 
h3. Actual Result

Label for the VERSIONNAME overlaps the information banner

 
h3. Expected Result

Label and the information banner are properly aligned.
fields.summary: information border on version report is to close to the "view in issue navigator" link

fields.description:
It's nice (though the limit is rather arbitrary) to be able to add three fields to the Kanban card layout. However, the values are displayed in a way that's seems like an afterthought.

It would improve the readability of the cards to at least label the additional fields. So, instead of something like this:
{quote}
migration need-feedback
 4
 4k
{quote}
… you'd see this …
{quote}
Labels:
 migration need-feedback

Story Points:
 4

Business Value:
 4k
{quote}
fields.summary: Add labels to extra fields in Kanban cards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Days in Column presents a cumulative result of all days an issue have spent in a given status. This is the default behaviour of the application, but sometimes it's useful to know how many days have passed since the issue came back to a previous status and not the cumulative values for it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option in Kanban boards to reset the days on column values.
fields.summary: Days in Column from Kanban boards should have an option to be reset.

fields.description:
If a user sets up JIRA in German, the "New Feature" issue type has the name "Neue Funktion". Unfortunately, Bitbucket Server's issue-type-to-branch-model matching is based on the issue type name. As a result, the branch model doesn't work.

Until we implement BSERV-4139, ensure that we support the default issue types for our 4 supported languages (English, German, French and Japanese). 

Created based on [Andreas's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4139?focusedCommentId=930840&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-930840] on a related issue.
fields.summary: Branch model should handle JIRA running in other languages
создание мобильного приложения

fields.description:
When reviewing a project from the Kanban board, in order to open an issue in full screen view, you must click on the issue, and then click on the issue number on the right preview screen. It would be extremely useful to enable a double click from the Kanban board to open up the desired issue in full screen view.

Thanks,
Demetrios
fields.summary: Double click issue from Kanban board to open full issue view

fields.description:
Presently, when a user clones an Epic, the Epic Name field is not presented in the clone screen.  The value is copied as is from the source Epic to the target Epic.  If the user who created the cloned Epic does not immediately edit the Epic Name field after the clone is created, this can lead to unintended duplication of Epic Names. 

To help prevent the confusion that can result from this duplication of Epic Names, please add the Epic Name field to the clone screen when an issue in the Epic Issue Type is cloned.  This will allow users to edit the field before the clone is completed in the same manner that the Summary field is presented for editing in the clone process.
fields.summary: Allow Epic Name field to be edited when an Epic is cloned

fields.description:
h3. Scenario

User is performing multiple project imports of projects that belonged to the same board / shared of the same sprint. For each import performed, JIRA creates a different sprint with the exact same name.

h3. Expected Behaviour

JIRA would notice that the Sprint already exists throughout the import and not create a new one.

h3. Workaround
Bulk edit the issue in the duplicated sprint to the original sprint by referring to the Sprint ID and not name. This will however, impact the reporting for the sprint if its related to an active sprint
fields.summary: Project Import imports the same sprint multiple times

fields.description:
For Agile planning, the existing "Backlog" view in a JIRA Scrum board is extremely limited and almost useless for real planning (though it is just barely better than nothing). 

We need a hierarchical view of Epics and Stories in one page so that we can 
* manage both epics and stories
* be able to actually read the Epics (current left hand column is way to small and not even an expandable panel), 
* easily see the hierarchy, 
* easily be able to select fields to show on that list, 
* have editable inline fields on the view, 
* drag and drop prioritization
* ability to move stories between epics, 
* etc. (hint: see VersionOne, Rally, TFS, Thoughtworks, etc, etc, etc, etc).

There is a reference to hierarchy in the community questions but there is no response from Atlassian. Its very old and this is clearly a huge miss in my opinion.
[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/933/hierarchical-view-of-epics-and-user-stories]
fields.summary: Hierarchy view for Epics and User Stories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

JIRA doesn't currently have a feature to automatically close an Epic if all of its Stories are Complete/Done. 

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a post-function to close an Epic if all of its Stories are Complete.
fields.summary: Provide a post-function or a feature to automatically close an Epic

fields.description:
When working within a Kanban or Scrum Board, a column represents multiple states such as our testing column:

Readying for Deployment to Test
Ready for Internal Testing
In Internal Testing
(from here it moves to either DONE (resolved) or "Failed Testing" (backlog)

Having the ability to march an issue through the workflow of the same column would be very helpful as we often will build up issues to be deployed to testing environment and tested so going into each issue and moving it in the workflow is a bit tedious.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Offer Workflow on Scrum / Kanban Board as when Viewing the Issue Details

fields.description:
h3. h3. 

 

The project lead in our company would like to have some sort of a report which will show the users involved or worked on the issues included on a released version. We don't use Log Work feature in JIRA so it's quite hard for us to track the users, probably the Assignee of the issues on a released version.

 
h3. SUGGESTION

It would be great if we can generate a report with the following information:
 * Released version
 * Issues on a released version
 * Users involved on the issues included on a released version
fields.summary: JIRA Released Version Report

fields.description:
Hi

I'm using jira agile for my project. 
Active Sprint View with swimlines is based on stories. When story has subtasks it's shown as a label with
- task number (as a link)
- status (fe. in_progress or open)
- number of subtasks
- name of task
but doesn't have epic link name, which is very important for me (of course is linked to it - see attachment). 

Is it possible somehow to add it in configuration or by update ?
fields.summary: Story swimlanes to display epic link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Create epic is not available as option in Backlog. Scrum Boards have a create epic on the side. 
*  !Scrum Board Epic.png|thumbnail! 

However, this is not available for Backlog (Kanban) Labs.
*  !Kanban Board Labs.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add Epic Tab in Backlog (Kanban) Labs as well 
 
h3. Workaround 
Create the issue from the top *Create* button. 
*  !Create button.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add Epic Tab in Kanban Labs (Similar to Backlog in Scrum Boards)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15013].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When trying to perform "Create Linked Issue" on Kanban/Scrum board, nothing happens.

h3. Environment
* Affected Version: 1000.0.0-D20160616T023228
* Kanban/Scrum board with Business project

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Kanban board with existing Business project
# Create an issue on the board
# View the issue on the board
# *...* > *Create Linked Issue"*
# *...* > *More Actions* > *Create Linked Issue*

h3. Expected Result
Create Linked Issue screen should be shown to continue the action.

h3. Actual Result
Step 4 -> It redirects user back to the board
Step 5 -> Is shows "Loading" forever
!Screenshot1.jpeg!

h3. Workaround
* Open the issue in new tab, then perform Create Linked Issue action
fields.summary: "Create Linked Issue" Action does not work on Software Board

fields.description:
!image-2016-10-04-15-03-12-347.png|thumbnail! 

Link currently takes you to the board config page, it should take you to a CAC page.

The dialog is being displayed because the board has more than one project.  You can't create issues inline on boards with multiple projects as the user has to select which project to create the issue in, so the full dialog is displayed.
fields.summary: Learn more link on inline-issue-create dialog should take you to CAC.

fields.description: In keeping with current Scrum terminology, replace the word "commitment" with "forecast" on the Velocity Report.
fields.summary: Replace word "commitment" to "forecast" on Velocity Report

fields.description: As a project stakeholder I would like to be able to have a dashboard gadget that would allow me to view the current sprint backlog.
fields.summary: Dashboard Gadget shows current sprint backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding bug|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15001].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When users try to add *Sprint Health Gadget* or *Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget* to a dashboard in Jira Cloud and their personal language setting is any non-English language, such as Spanish, Korean, Chinese, Japanese, etc the gadgets fail to display any useful information.  Instead users get a permission error incorrectly, such as
{quote}Cannot view the request panel because it does not exist or you do not have permission to view
{quote}
 This quote is translated from Chinese to English.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud v1000.383.2 (I don't have a permission to add new *Affects Version/s* that's why I wrote here.)
 * Jira Server 7.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board
 # Create a sprint
 # Add an issue to the backlog
 # Start the sprint
 # Change user language to a different language, for example Japanese. So far we have confirmed this problem happens at least when language of user is in Spanish, Korean, Japanese, or Chinese (but more languages likely affected as well)
 # Add *Sprint Health Gadget ("スプリントヘルスガジェット" in Japanese)* or *Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget ("スプリントガジェット内の残り日数" in Japanese)* to a dashboard
 # Set sprint as *Next Sprint Due (auto)* ("次のスプリント期限（自動）" in Japanese) in the configuration
 # Press "Save" button

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should be added correctly.
 !sprint-health-gadget-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

An error "リクエストしたボードを表示できません。ボードが存在しないかまたは表示する権限がありません。" was shown. ("The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it." in English.)
 !sprint-health-gadget-1.png|thumbnail!

Just changing the user language back to English didn't solve the problem.
h3. Notes
 * This problem never occurred on *JIRA 6.4.x*
 * This problem never occurred on *Sprint Burndown Gadget*
 * Investigation
 When pressing the "Save" button, I can find the following accesses in developer tool.
 When it comes to the one in Japanese setting, *sprintId* seems to be corrupted.
 ** Pressing the "Save" button in Japanese setting
 --- [https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/gadgets/sprints/health?rapidViewId=7&sprintId=%26%2333258%3B%26%2321205%3B&_=1475197516579]
 ** Pressing the "Save" button in English setting
 --- [https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/gadgets/sprints/health?rapidViewId=7&sprintId=15&_=1475197064445]

h3. Workaround
 # Change the user language back to English
 # Edit the sprint health gadget on the dashboard, and save it again.
 # Change the user language back to their desired setting again
fields.summary: Adding Sprint Health Gadget / Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget does not work when user language setting is not English
Ability to add previous completed sprints to Release Burndown report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, then browsing an issue in the Detail View of a project, clicking on an issue link within the detail view won’t take you anywhere

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be ideal if clicking an issue link within the detail view would send you to issue (instead of doing nothing)

h3. Workaround 

For now, you have to right-click and open the linked issue in a new tab or window
fields.summary: In the Detail View of a project, Issue Links don't click through

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Cannot search for subtask within the backlog. Related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-7992.

Subtask are not seen in the backlog, only parent stories are. 

!basic search.png|thumbnail!
h3. !appearsactive.png|thumbnail!

!backlog search.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Have the ability to show subtask in the backlog (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-7992) and have the ability to search the backlog for subtask
fields.summary: Search for subtask within the backlog
Pagerduty incident

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the [JIRA Software Labs Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/JIRA+Software+Labs#JIRASoftwareLabs-kanbanbacklogKanbanBacklog], there is not much information on how the new Kanban Board works. 

Compared to Scrum Boards, where there is only one status mapped in the Backlog, in the Kanban Board there are two statuses. 

This is because the status from the next column is also added to the Backlog in order to easily move issues to Plan, similarly as adding issues to Sprint in Scrum Boards. This however can be confusing, since there is only one status mapped to this column.

h3. Suggested Solution

Edit the documentation with more detailed information about the Kanban Boards.
fields.summary: Update the Kanban Board Documentation

fields.description:
When viewing a Task, there is an option to "Show Open" for the "Sub-Tasks" section of the Task.

When viewing an Epic, there is no option to "Show Open" for the Tasks in the "Issues in Epic" section of the Epic.

It's nice to be able to hide completed Issues to reduce visual clutter.
fields.summary: add option to "Show Open" for "Issues in Epic" section of Epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the newly created sprint edit the number at the end. 
Example:
The Sprint named *Sprint X.Y.Z*

As of this moment the Z number is changed. The customer would want to have it configured, so it can change as for the Y number. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add configuration for the Sprint Naming
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually rename the Sprint
fields.summary: Add ability to configure Sprint naming

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Github repositories are getting stuck in a perpetual synchronization state. Attempting a full synchronization or restarting the JIRA application does not clear this condition. Consequently, updates to development information in Github are not being displayed in the development panel in JIRA issue views.

h2. Environment
JIRA Cloud {{v1000.184.1}}

h2. Workaround
Please contact Atlassian Support to apply the fix
fields.summary: DVCS Github Synchronization Failing

fields.description: Currently, the only way to remove an Epic from the Epic List in a scrum backlog is to manually go to the Epic and select 'Mark as Done'. Some users might want the Epic to be removed automatically if the Epic itself is already in a Done status and has a Resolution. It might be useful to have an option set to allow this.
fields.summary: Removal of Epic from Scrum Backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14984].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Issues which Sprint has been set at creation issue screen will not appear in burndown chart if the sprint is removed from this issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Software Project
 # Create a Sprint - You can start the Sprint or not.
 # Create an issue and set the Sprint in the issue creation screen
 ** Start the Sprint if you have not started.
 # Remove the issue from the Sprint.

h3. Expected Results

The burndown chart would show the issue as "Scope change issue removed"
h3. Actual Results

The burndown chart does not show the issue on it and make it seems like the issue never existed.
h3. Workaround

The only known workaround for now is to put the issue back in the Sprint after removal and then remove again
h3. Note

Affected deleted issue.
fields.summary: Issue removed from Sprint not showing in Burndown Chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14982].
  {panel}

 

If you create a board based on a jql query the issues that are displayed come from many projects. The board configuration then mentions "The projects in this board cannot be listed because of the complexity of the board filter"

 
In such a configuration, the sidebar only mentions Kanban board/Reports/Invite your team but not any of the other links that you usually have on a board.
 
If the query returns only one (or a few) projects, bug JSW-13650 is applicable; but when the query is returning many jira-projects then JIRA cannot automatically deduce what needs to be shown. In such a situation, the Board configuration must contain options so that the board designer can specify what needs to be shown.
 
At the minimum the shortcut list must be configurable. Best also if the board dropdown list can be reused to link to other boards.
 
 
 
Example: specialisation across development teams.
Across the JIRA projects a specific subtask can be used (eg "infrastructure subtask"); or issues can be labled with "performance" .
Developers with that specific skillset need to (also) work across the teams. Hence they want a board showing all issues that eg require such a specialist to work on.
 
For such a board the releases link probably makes no sense as it would end up showing the releases of the entire company. But the board can contain shortcuts to sites that are frequently used by performance devs.
 
Example 2: Make a board to have an overview for a business program with all showstoppers / with all ongoing stories.
JQL: epic_link= "my epic" and type=bug and priority=Blocker
JQL: epic_link = "my epic" and sprint in opensprints()
 
While the issues may be scattered across the enterprise, the 80/20 rule dictates that most are inside a few JIRA projects. So it makes sense that next to the icon/name of this blocker-board there are links to the core-related JIRA boards.
fields.summary: Board using jql query across projects also need to have shortcuts and board links

fields.description:
*Request of the Background*

Currently, Jira cloud cannot create application link with a privately hosted bitbucket instance.
fields.summary: Application link between cloud and privately hosted instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a user needs to work with the board, they need to navigate to the board from the top menu. It would be really handy to have the board on the dashboard so that a user can drag drop issues right from the dashboard. 



h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a Agile board gadget on the dashboard that is interactive as well.
fields.summary: As a user, it would be very useful to have the boards as an interactive gadget on the dashboard

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, the following REST command
{code}
GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/configuration
{code}
only gives the information of column management, estimation, and ranking. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the a full information including working days, card layouts, etc.
fields.summary: Board Configuration REST API should include complete configuration detail

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, in JIRA Software Server, backlog view, if the active sprint is collapsed, the start and end dates of the sprint are not shown. User has to expand the sprint in order to view it. 
!server.png|thumbnail!

This is not the case with JIRA Software Cloud, where the start and end date are still shown, even when the active sprint is collapsed

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the same display in JIRA Software Server, in such a way that the active sprint's start and end dates are shown, even when the sprint is collapsed
fields.summary: Show Active Sprint's start and End date on backlog when Sprint is collapsed in Server instance

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results

Assignee and Reporter fields have different order in agile board and issue view.
h3. Expected Result

Assignee and Reporter fields should have the same order in agile board and issue view.
fields.summary: Assignee and Reporter fields have wrong order in agile board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Sprints are reordered in a SCRUM Backlog prior to being started, they are assigned a 'SEQUENCE ID' that takes presedence over the 'SPRINT ID' when ordered running sprints. This causes a large amount of confusion to Users as well as Project Administrators as the SCRUM UI does not offer any indication as to why the ordering is not appearing as one would assume it should.
h3. Environment

Cloud - 1000.350.1
 Server - Current
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new SCRUM Software Development Project
 or
 # Open an existing SCRUM Software Development Project
 # Create several sprints (you do not need to add issues to the Sprints)
 # Start at least one Sprint
 # Reorder several of the remaining Sprints within the backlog
 # Start the remaining Sprints

h3. Expected Results

The Sprints should follow the order in which they were started
h3. Actual Results

The Sprints follow the order in which their SPRINT IDs and if populated, their SEQUENCE IDs follow

Example:
{noformat}
jira=> select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "NAME" like '%TSSI%';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE | END_DATE | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED | START_DATE | GOAL
--------+---------------+----------+----+---------------+---------------+----------+---------+------------+------
 f      |               |          | 33 |    Sprint 1   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 34 |    Sprint 2   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 35 |    Sprint 3   |            30 |          | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 36 |    Sprint 4   |            30 |          | f       |            |
(4 rows)




{noformat}
The above table shows the Sprints prior to being started and reordered in the Backlog. Notice there is no SEQUENCE ID populated for any of the Sprints.
{noformat}
jira=> select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "NAME" like '%TSSI%';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE | END_DATE | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED | START_DATE | GOAL
--------+---------------+----------+----+---------------+---------------+----------+---------+------------+------
 f      |               |          | 36 |    Sprint 4   |           30  |       35 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 34 |    Sprint 2   |           30  |       36 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 33 |    Sprint 1   |           30  |       34 | f       |            |
 f      |               |          | 35 |    Sprint 3   |           30  |       33 | f       |            |
(4 rows)




{noformat}
The above table shows the Sprints after being reordered. You will notice that the Sprints all have SEQUENCE IDs populated now which fall in line with their updated position in the overall order of Sprints. After starting all of these Sprints the SCRUM UI would render them in this order:
{noformat}
Sprint 3
Sprint 1
Sprint 4
Sprint 2




{noformat}
h3. Feature Request

It would be extremely helpful if it was possible to do one or all of the following within the SCRUM UI Backlog:
 - Reorder Sprints once they have been started
 - The ability to change the SEQUENCE ID of each Sprint
 - The ability to see the SEQUENCE ID in relation to the SPRINT ID
 - JIRA ordered solely based on the SEQUENCE ID and did not take the SPRINT ID into consideration in this case
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I would like more robust options for Sprints prior to and after starting each Sprint within a SCRUM board

fields.description: Thanks for adding me in this
fields.summary: Add new feature

fields.description:
For a small local team, e.g. in operations, it is important to see all the various running and pending tasks on one single board even if they belong to different categories/projects and have different workflows. 

We might e.g. have a simple workflow for fixing issues, a complex one for doing large upgrades involving many different steps over longer periods of time, one for evaluating new components, etc. etc.

Jira should allow us to visualize and use all our different workflows on one single board, like e.g. LeanKit does (see attached picture).
fields.summary: Allow per swimlane column layouts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

There is no way to order Issues shown in released version page by Rank at the moment. As a user, I'd like to see which issue has the highest rank/backlog priority.
- https://<instance URL>/projects/<project name>/versions/<version ID>/tab/release-report-done

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to order issues by Rank in Release version page.
fields.summary: An option to order issues by Rank in Release Hub
SA Configurations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When releasing a version on JIRA it's no longer possible to select plans from different Bamboo Servers if there are more than one connected to JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have more than one Bamboo linked with JIRA
# Go to a JIRA project and try to release a version selecting the option to "_Build and release_"
# Select the "_with new build_" option

h3. Expected Results
You can select plans from all different Bamboo Servers linked to JIRA

h3. Actual Results
You can only select from one of them (usually the primary one)
 

h3.Workaround
Manually release the build directly on Bamboo
fields.summary: Regression: Release Button only works with primary Bamboo server

fields.description: See attached image
fields.summary: Layout issue on Safari Version 8.0.7 (10600.7.12)

fields.description:
Since the last two or three days i've been noticing that when a merge is done from a specific branch to master branch and closing the source branch, the issue's dev section appears empty with a link "Create branch" as it was never created and no commit was ever done...
This is causing troubles in code review and tracking; because it's not possible anymore to see what a developer did to a specific issue, but looking in the master branch's history (which obviously is quite large since everytime a issue is done, a merge to master is done) and is taking too much time.
fields.summary: Commit tracking lost with Bitbucket integration

fields.description:
We have the problem, that in every project the Development "Widget" is showing up, even if the project is connected with stash or not.
!DevelopmentWidget.png|thumbnail!
So the Users are creating support request with questions about this "Widget" or with error messages because they do not have access to the stash instance.
Could you please fix this and disable the Development "Widget" with projects which do not have a project link to stash.
!projectlink.png|thumbnail!
The same with the Source Tab under activities...
!ActivitySourceTab.png|thumbnail!

In our opinion this is clearly a bug.

Thanks
Martin
fields.summary: The Development "Widget" is showing in project without stash link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today, the _Crucible: Hassle Review Blockers_ gadget only shows the 5 first results. If you have more results to see, you need to scroll down the gadget, which difficulties to see the Reviewer of the tickets when you have a quite few reviews from the same one.

h3. Suggested Solution
Option to re-size the gadget or show more results in the visible area (like 20 lines).
fields.summary: Option to re-size the Crucible: Hassle Review Blockers

fields.description: In our workflow, we will often make multiple pull requests for a given ticket (say one to a Continuous Integration branch and another to our develop/master branch). When we pull up the pull request overlay, there is basically no way of knowing which branch the pull request is destined for without opening the actual request, which is a nuisance.
fields.summary: Display target branch on the pull request overlay panel
